description: First attested 1830, back-formation from ramshackled, from ransackled, past participle of ransackle (“to ransack”), frequentative of Middle English ransaken (“to pillage”).

adjectives.description: ramshackle (comparative more ramshackle, superlative most ramshackle)

entries.meaning: In disrepair or disorder; poorly maintained; lacking upkeep, usually of buildings or vehicles.
examples: They stayed in a ramshackle cabin on the beach.

verbs.description: ramshackle (third-person singular simple present ramshackles, present participle ramshackling, simple past and past participle ramshackled)
